rss.channel:
http://www.folkcast.co.uk/folkcast.rss FolkCast The UK's top folk music podcast bringing you the best in folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter and roots-based music from around the world. A new show on the first Saturday of each month. http://www.folkcast.co.uk Copyright 2008 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows and folkcast.co.uk. See Terms Of Use for full details. http://blogs.law.harvard.edu/tech/rss en Sun, 26 Jul 2009 19:00:00 +0100
folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter, roots, acoustic, music, UK, British, English, tradition, traditions Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows
contact@folkcast.co.uk Phil Widdows and Ken Nicol
no My Podcast Alley feed! {pca-f6f681cf682941c0bb83effef90ff206}
FolkCast 033 - October 2008 A stack of new releases, tour news and Babba tells the history of an Australian anti-hero. Music from: Dave Pegg and PJ Wright - Steve Tilston - Black Rat - Broken Poets - Bellowhead - Red Ruth - Genticorum - Bella Hardy - Mary Hampton - Kate Doubleday - Box Club - Zoe Conway - The Story. http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes033.html
Sat, 04 Oct 2008 19:01:00 +0100 1:17:56 Phil Widdows no
FolkCast Summer Sizzler 2008 Music all the way with this collection of new-to-us songs from some of the great artists we have played on FolkCast over the past 12 months or so. Available to subscribers only. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk for a full track listing. http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotessizzler08.html
Sun, 24 Aug 2008 14:01:00 +0100 1:17:56 Phil Widdows no
FolkCast 032 Part One - August 2008 Part One of an extended edition before we take a month's break. Featuring news of Steeleye Span's tour plans for next year, and music from - The Simon Hopper Band - The Demon Barbers - Aiden Jolly - Ruth Theodore - The Parson Red Heads - Peter Bradley Adams - Jim Averitt - Embertime - Andy Patterson. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk. http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes032.html
Sat, 16 Aug 2008 14:01:00 +0100 0:52:03 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows no
FolkCast 032 Part Two - August 2008 Part Two of an extended edition before we take a month's break. Featuring Babba with The Story Behind The Song of Bedlam Boys, and music from - Zywiolak - Chris Hardy - Hilary James - Corrina Hewat - Mike Silver. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk. http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes032.html
Sat, 16 Aug 2008 14:00:00 +0100 0:38:00 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows no
FolkCast 031 - July 2008 In a tribute show to Woven Wheat Whispers (RIP), Jo joins Phil to present music from: The Horses Of The Gods - Steve Tilston - Reg Meuross - Lisa Redford - The Purple Minds Of Lazeron - Dave Malloy - Marie Crehan - Sharron Shannon and Steve Earle - Vicki Swan and Jonny Dyer - Comrade Down - Steve O ' Connor - Show Of Hands - The Story. Babba examines the true history of the naval Press Gang in the Story Behind The Song for All Things Are Quite Silent. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk. http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes030.html
Sat, 05 Jul 2008 17:15:00 +0100 1:17:54 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows no
FolkCast 030 - June 2008 Music from Telling The Bees - Black Fortress Of Opium - Blackheart - John Haydon - Andy Mullen - Eliza Carthy - One More Grain - Eduard Iniesta - Lizzie Nunnery - Lawn Jockey - Steamchicken - The Duncan McFarlane Band. Babba reveals the myth and magic behind The Blacksmith, and Phil opens his Folk Files. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk. http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes030.html
Sat, 07 Jun 2008 16:00:00 +0100 1:17:54 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows no
FolkCast 029 - May 2008 Music from Plunkett, Stormy Mondays, Twelve Thousand Days, Temple Music, Kiss The Mistress, Trouble At'Mill, Zoox, The Albion Band, The Battlefield Band, Kila, Tanglefoot, Jahrtal, Phillip Hartley, Scullion John, SixPeopleAway. Babba concludes his two-part special on Transportation to Australia. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk. Re-mixed edition. http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes029.html
Sun, 04 May 2008 23:00:00 +0000 1:17:58 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows no

FolkCast 025 - January 2008 The best in folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter and roots-based music. New music from Kerfuffle - Nuada - Paul Liddell - Mieka Pauley - Phonix - The Mountain Firework Company - The Gala Band - Robin Allender - Andy McKee - James Dewdney - Abra Moore - Caroline Lavelle - Alistair Christl - The Duncan McFarlane Band. Babba tells the story behind Parcel Of Rogues, and there is a chance to win CDs from Dreamboat Records. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes025.html

FolkCast Interview - Ashley Hutchings - The Mother Of All Morris We talk to Ashley Hutchings about the release of the latest - and last - of the Morris On albums, The Mother Of All Morris. And there's lots of music from the album, too. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotesmother.html
Sat, 01 Dec 2007 12:30:00 +0000 FolkCast Interview - Ashley Hutchings - The Mother Of All Morris We talk to Ashley Hutchings about the release of the latest - and last - of the Morris On albums, The Mother Of All Morris. And there's lots of music from the album, too. See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk 0:24:48 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows no
FolkCast 024 - December 2007 The best in folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter and roots-based music. We look back over the year and present new songs from some of our favourite artists. Babba uncorks the badger wine and gets in festive mood with an unusual "Story Behind The Song", and we've music from the latest, and last, Morris On album. Music this month comes from Charlotte Kendrick, Debbie Cassell, Rev Hammer, Lau, Naughty Jack, Jon London, Oysterband, Dahm The Bard, Leatherat, Silver Dogs, Steve Knightley, Nick Cook, Sarah McQuaid, The Morris On Band See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes024.html
Sat, 01 Dec 2007 12:30:00 +0000 FolkCast 024 - December 2007 The best in folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter and roots-based music. We look back over the year and present new songs from some of our favourite artists. Music this month comes from Charlotte Kendrick, Debbie Cassell, Rev Hammer, Lau, Naughty Jack, Jon London, Oysterband, Dahm The Bard, Leatherat, Silver Dogs, Steve Knightley, Nick Cook, Sarah McQuaid, The Morris On Band See the ShowNotes at www.folkcast.co.uk 1:17:18 Ken Nicol and Phil Widdows no

FolkCast Interview Special with Abbie Lathe An exclusive interview with singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and teacher Abbie Lathe, featuring music from her latest album, Low Summer. See www.folkcast.co.uk http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotesabbie.html

FolkCast 022 - October 2007 The best in folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter and roots-based music. We talk to Italian musician Ernesto de Pascale about his new album, Morning Manic Music, and hear songs from the record. Babba reveals the astonishing story of John Churchill, better known as Lord Marlborough, in The Story Behind The Song, and there is music from Kate Bramley - Jez Lowe - Songs From The Blue House - Marina Florence - Paolo Giorgi - Mike Hanrahan - 3 Daft Monkeys. See www.folkcast.co.uk http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes022.html

Babba reveals the astonishing story of John Churchill, better known as Lord Marlborough, in The Story Behind The Song, and there is music from Kate Bramley - Jez Lowe - Songs From The Blue House - Marina Florence - Paolo Giorgi - Mike Hanrahan - 3 Daft Monkeys. FolkCast 021 - September 2007 The best in folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter and roots-based music. We talk to Chopper from Oysterband and play music from their latest studio album, Meet You There. Babba raises a glass of ale to John Barleycorn in The Story Behind The Song, and there is music from Nick Cook - Legendary Ten Seconds - Jon Croose - Charlotte Kendrick - The Stanley Brothers - Martin Ansell - Round Mountain - The Clap - Leatherat. See www.folkcast.co.uk http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes021.html

FolkCast 020 - August 2007 The best in folk, folk-rock, singer-songwriter and roots-based music. We talk to Mark Coyle of Woven Wheat Whispers about the new compilation of Dark British Folk, John Barleycorn Reborn. Babba goes to sea to tell The Story Behind... The Mary Stanford Of Rye. Music from Faith, Folk and Anarchy - Jenna - John Statz - The Owl Service - Sharron Kraus - Tinkerscuss - Drohn - The Story - Phil Hare - Sarah McQuaid - Meet On The Ledge. See www.folkcast.co.uk http://www.folkcast.co.uk/ShowNotes/shownotes020.html
